reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)

description.narrative: Unallocated funds for 2016. Frame agreement's primary focus is on reaching the most deprived children in fragile states especially girls. Special focus will be given to gender sensitivity promotion of child participation and integration of Disaster Risk Re duction into programming work. SCF will work within three thematic areas: Child Poverty Child Protection and Education.Outcomes for Child Poverty:Outcome 1)Social Protection strategies and programs are made child sensitive, Indicators:1.1.SP policy and pro gramme implementation addresses deprivation and vulnerability of childrenOutcome 2) Improved access to SP programmes of deprived households and increased well-being of their children. (including emergencies) Indicators:2.1.Improved access to SP of deprived households a) increased access in numbers, b) improved usage of statutory mechanisms 2.2.Improved well-being of children in households accessing SP a) # of children with improved nutrition improved school attendance reduced child labour b) improvement as reported by children.Outcomes for Child Protection: Outcome 1) Community child protection systems are strengthened to meet the needs of the most deprived children and to respond effectively to emergencies and other shocks, Indicators:1.1. # of targeted CP service providers / interventions which have improved their quality of serviceOutcome 2) Children including those on the move have access to appropriate family-based support protection and careIndicator: 1.2. % of children who are satisfied with the CP ser vices available or provided in their communities 2.1. % of supported families that demonstrate changes in attitudes and behaviour and which have favoured the protection of children from violenOutcomes for Education:Outcome 1): access to ECCD services and n ew Foundation Year of Basic Education for children aged 5 years Outcome 2): quality of ECCD services and Foundation Class learning environments have improved in all SC supported schools Outcome 3): National policies practice and implementation based on chi ld rights and child centered approaches in National education sector planning and programming processes
